install.description:
JEZ Rego - Premium quality Joomla! 1.5 template.

Please visit JoomlaEZ.com for full features list, editions comparison, licenses comparison and get support on implementing / customizing JEZ Rego.

Copyright | Read Me | Install Sample Data as seen in JEZ Rego live demo

params.param:
Choose a suitable font set for your website. Each font set is actually a combination of 2 fonts: one for content text and the other for heading / main navigation text.

  • Mixed Goods

    Default font set chosen by JoomlaEZ designers when creating the raw design in Photoshop. This is a set of some difference fonts for difference elements, not just heading and content text.

  • Business / Corporate

    Heading text: Verdana (general) / Geneva (Mac OS)

    Content text: Arial (general) / Helvetica (Mac OS)

  • Personal / Blog

    Heading text: Georgia (general) / Serif (Mac OS)

    Content text: Trebuchet MS (general) / Helvetica (Mac OS)

  • Online News / Magazines

    Heading text: Palatino Linotype (general) / Palatino (Mac OS)

    Content text: Times New Roman (general) / Times (Mac OS)

Here you can set layout unit and the overall template width as long as some nested containers' width and/or height.

  • Fixed (px unit)

    Template and columns' width is always fixed regardless of difference client computer's screen resolution and browser's width and font size.

  • Elastic (em unit)

    Template and columns' width is fixed regardless of difference client computer's screen resolution and browser's width. Template and columns' width will change automatically if visitors change font size either via the template's font resizer tool or in their browser's option.

  • Fluid (% unit)

    Template and columns' width is fixed regardless of difference browser's font size. Template and columns' width will change automatically to fit client computer's screen resolution and browser's width.

Template, Left Column and Right Column Width MUST BE specified in the same unit for correct layout rendering!

Specify just the (decimal) number to use in combination with selected layout unit above.

If you really need to use unit other than the default selected above, specify (decimal) number immediately followed by either px, em or % unit.

Template, Left Column and Right Column Width MUST BE specified in the same unit for correct layout rendering!

Specify just the (decimal) number to use in combination with selected layout unit above.

If you really need to use unit other than the default selected above, please remember that while you can specify (decimal) number immediately followed by either px, em or % unit for width, USE ONLY px or em unit for height!

Raw Output is enabled by passing tmpl=component name/value pairs via page URL. Sample uses of Raw Output are pages opened when clicking article's Print and Email icons in Joomla frontend.

Below you can choose whether or not always displaying header and footer in Raw Output page.

Besides specify default theme above, there are 2 additional ways for switching theme for any frontend page outputed by Joomla using JEZ Rego template:

  • Via Page Class Suffix

    If enabled, when adding / editing menu item you can specify theme to render page associated with that menu item. This can be done by defining Page Class Suffix parameter in following format tpl_theme@theme-name.

    For example, to use Orange theme for About Us page, you simply need to input tpl_theme@orange as Page Class Suffix for menu item associated with the About Us page.

  • Via URL

    If enabled, theme can be switched right in Joomla frontend for any page by passing variable tpl_theme via URL. See example below for details: 

    index.php => Rendered with default theme
index.php?tpl_theme=blue => Switched to Blue theme

index.php?option=com_search => Rendered with default theme
index.php?option=com_search&tpl_theme=green => Switched to Green theme

index.php/contacts.html => Rendered with default theme
index.php/contacts.html?tpl_theme=leaf => Switched to Leaf theme

param.name: showThemeSwitcher
param.label: Theme Switcher
param.description: If above option is enabled and no any module is configured to show at tool position, show theme switcher?

param.name: logo
param.label: Logo Image
param.description: Relative path from Joomla root dir to your site's logo image

param.name: logoAlt
param.label: Logo Alt Text
param.description: Alternative text to use for logo img tag's alt attribute. Leave blank to use page title dynamically

param.name: logoWidth
param.label: Logo Width
param.description: Specify just the (decimal) number to use in combination with selected layout unit above. If you really need to use unit other than the default selected above, specify (decimal) number immediately followed by either px, em or % unit

param.name: logoHeight
param.label: Logo Height
param.description: Specify just the (decimal) number to use in combination with selected layout unit above. Please remember that while you can specify (decimal) number immediately followed by either px, em or % unit for width, use only px or em unit for height

params.param: If enabled, use JavaScript to create smooth dropdown / flyout effects for multi-level mod_mainmenu module configured to show at user3 module position.

param.name: navFx_fxDuration
param.label: Effect Duration
param.description: Effect duration in milliseconds

param.name: navFx_firstSubDirection
param.label: Dropdown Direction
param.description: Direction of dropdown effect (occured when mouse over first level sub menus): vertical, horizontal or both

param.name: navFx_deeperSubDirection
param.label: Flyout Direction
param.description: Direction of flyout effect (occured when mouse over deeper level / nested sub menus): vertical, horizontal or both

params.param: If enabled and there is no any module configured to show at top module position, font resizer tool will be displayed at that module position.

param.name: @desc
param.label: Home Page Component Output
param.description: Whether or not displaying component output on home page (page associated with default menu item)?

param.name: @desc
param.label: How To Expand If Center Column Not Available
param.description: If just left and right columns available in top / content block, expand which column: left, right or both?

param.name: @desc
param.label: IE6 Warning
param.description: Whether or not displaying warning for visitor using IE6 browser?

param.name: @desc
param.label: PNG-24 Fix for IE6
param.description: Whether or not enabling PNG-24 fix for IE6 browser?

params.param: Do PNG-24 fix for selected images (images that has class png24) or for all images with extension .png?

param.name: @desc
param.label: Add Support for Hover/Focus in IE6
param.description: By enabling this option, the template will add hover/focus state support for list and form elements which is lacked support in IE6.

param.name: @desc
param.label: Vertical Rhythm Support
param.description: If enabled, the template will automatically add neccessary margin to WYSIWYG editor frame and all images to prevent broken of typography's vertical rhythm.

params.param: Load script which render reflection effect to all images that has class reflect. Read details.

param.name: @desc
param.label: Internal Links Detection
param.description: List all (sub-)domains, separated by comma, which belong to your site here to prevent affection of external link style to internal link.

params.param:
Modify link to open in modal window for all <a> elements which match any of following conditions.

Besides the options to convert article's PDF, print and email icons links to open in modal window, you can define up to 10 additional custom modal link conversion rules.

param.name: modalPdfSize
param.label: Modal Window Size
param.description: Modal window size (width x height) in px or % unit for PDF icon link

param.name: modalPrintSize
param.label: Modal Window Size
param.description: Modal window size (width x height) in px or % unit for Print icon link

param.name: modalEmailSize
param.label: Modal Window Size
param.description: Modal window size (width x height) in px or % unit for Email icon link

params.param:
By enabling dev mode, you can easily turn on/off any position right in frontend via page URL to see how your site looks like when that position is empty or turn on/off any other template parameter to see how that parameter works.

ENABLING DEV MODE IS NOT RECOMMENDED FOR PRODUCTION SITE!

param.name: dev_rememberParams
param.label: Remember Params
param.description: Use cookie to remember parameters passed in via page URL or form submission

param.name: dev_cookieLifetime
param.label: Cookie Lifetime
param.description: Days to remember parameters passed in via page URL or form submission. 0 to remember till end of current browsing session

param.name: dev_panel
param.label: Dev Mode Panel
param.description: If dev mode is enabled, show dev panel in frontend?
